elements.name: question1
elements.title: What is meant by the binding nature of an offer?
elements.correctAnswer: Commitment refers to how the supplier must adhere to his offer - i.e. whether he must sell his product or not if the buyer accepts the offer.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: How do you differentiate between binding and non-binding offers? Explain.
elements.correctAnswer: Binding offers must be complied with and are enforceable in court. Non-binding offers, on the other hand, do not have to be honored.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Explain the difference between a material error and an immaterial error.
elements.correctAnswer: If a product is clearly, i.e. obviously, incorrect, this is a material error. An immaterial error is an error that cannot be detected by most customers.
